text: الا موتتنا الاولى وما نحن بمعذبين

translations.translation: except for our first death? Are we not going to be punished?
Other than our first death, and we shall not be punished?
except for our first death? And shall we suffer no chastisement?'”
and that we would not be punished?"
“Except our earlier death, and nor will we be punished?”
Except our first death, and we shall not be punished"
Except our previous death? And we shall not be chastised?
except for our first death, and are we not chastised?
Saving our former death, and are we not to be punished?
except for our first death? Are we not going to be punished?
Save our first death, and are we not to be tormented?
aside from our earlier death, and that we shall not be punished?
Except our first death, and that we shall not be punished?"
Except our first death, and we shall not be punished? (after we have entered Paradise)."
except our first death, and shall we not be punished'
Except for our first death, and we will not be punished.”
Except for our first death, and we will not be punished?"

[37:59] aside from our first death, that is, the one [which we suffered] in this world, and are we not to be chastised?’ — this interrogative statement is one made out of [sheer] delight and in order to speak [at length] of the graces of God, exalted be He, in [His] granting of everlasting life and refraining from inflicting any punishment.

(Saving our former death) after our death in the life of the world. They would say to him: "Yes, indeed!" Thereupon he will hear a crier crying: "0 people of hell! The fire is now closed; none will enter it or leave it", and he will say to his brothers: (and are we not to be punished) after the Fire is closed? And their answer will be in the affirmative.

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: بل لا موت لنا { إِلاَّ مَوْتَتَنَا ٱلأُولَىٰ } التي متنا عن الدنيا { وَمَا نَحْنُ بِمُعَذَّبِينَ } [الصافات: 59] أيضاً أمثالكم
